headline.main: Pakistan Bans Airing of 'Undesired' Contraceptive Advertisements
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Bans Airing of 'Undesired' Contraceptive Advertisements

docs.snippet: Pakistan has banned advertisements for contraceptive products on television and radio over concern that they expose inquisitive children to the subject of sex, local media reported on Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Pakistan has banned advertisements for contraceptive products on television and radio over concern that they expose inquisitive children to the subject of sex, local media reported on Saturday.

headline.main: UNESCO Chief Sees Threat From Cultural Destruction
headline.print_headline: UNESCO Chief Sees Threat From Cultural Destruction

docs.snippet: The world community has yet to find an adequate response to cultural destruction as shown by the deliberate wrecking of ancient sites in Syria and Mali by Islamist radicals, the head of the UN's cultural organization said....
docs.lead_paragraph: The world community has yet to find an adequate response to cultural destruction as shown by the deliberate wrecking of ancient sites in Syria and Mali by Islamist radicals, the head of the UN's cultural organization said.

headline.main: Tips From Henin Helps Svitolina to Oust Ivanovic
headline.print_headline: Tips From Henin Helps Svitolina to Oust Ivanovic

docs.snippet: Ana Ivanovic's hopes of adding to her 2008 French Open success ended rather tamely on Saturday as she was beaten by Justine Henin's new charge, Ukrainian 18th seed Elina Svitolina, in the third round on Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ana Ivanovic's hopes of adding to her 2008 French Open success ended rather tamely on Saturday as she was beaten by Justine Henin's new charge, Ukrainian 18th seed Elina Svitolina, in the third round on Saturday.

headline.main: Once Dismissed, Shark Attacks May Hit New Record in 2016
headline.print_headline: Once Dismissed, Shark Attacks May Hit New Record in 2016

docs.snippet: As the summer beach season opens in the United States, at least one expert is predicting an increase in shark attacks around the world this year that will surpass last year's record number....
docs.lead_paragraph: As the summer beach season opens in the United States, at least one expert is predicting an increase in shark attacks around the world this year that will surpass last year's record number.

headline.main: Xi Says China Should Invest More in the Elderly
headline.print_headline: Xi Says China Should Invest More in the Elderly

docs.snippet: China should increase investment in care for the elderly, President Xi Jinping told a meeting of the country's top leaders on its ageing population, official Xinhua news agency reported....
docs.lead_paragraph: China should increase investment in care for the elderly, President Xi Jinping told a meeting of the country's top leaders on its ageing population, official Xinhua news agency reported.

headline.main: Murray Aware of Nadal Injury During Practice
headline.print_headline: Murray Aware of Nadal Injury During Practice

docs.snippet: Andy Murray knew nine-times French Open champion Rafael Nadal was struggling with a wrist injury when he practised with the Spaniard during the build-up to Roland Garros....
docs.lead_paragraph: Andy Murray knew nine-times French Open champion Rafael Nadal was struggling with a wrist injury when he practised with the Spaniard during the build-up to Roland Garros.

headline.main: Spain Police Nab 7 Suspects of Large Francis Bacon Art Heist
headline.print_headline: Spain Police Nab 7 Suspects of Large Francis Bacon Art Heist

docs.snippet: Seven people suspected of being involved in stealing five paintings by the Irish-born painter Francis Bacon worth more than 25 million euros ($27.8 million) have been arrested, Spanish police said Saturday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Seven people suspected of being involved in stealing five paintings by the Irish-born painter Francis Bacon worth more than 25 million euros ($27.8 million) have been arrested, Spanish police said Saturday.

headline.main: Ricciardo Takes First F1 Pole in Monaco
headline.print_headline: Ricciardo Takes First F1 Pole in Monaco

docs.snippet: Australian Daniel Ricciardo seized the first pole position of his Formula One career at the Monaco Grand Prix on Saturday with world championship leader Nico Rosberg joining him on the front row for Mercedes....
docs.lead_paragraph: Australian Daniel Ricciardo seized the first pole position of his Formula One career at the Monaco Grand Prix on Saturday with world championship leader Nico Rosberg joining him on the front row for Mercedes.

headline.main: Haj Row Escalates as Iran and Saudi Arabia Miss New Deal
headline.print_headline: Haj Row Escalates as Iran and Saudi Arabia Miss New Deal

docs.snippet: An Iranian delegation has left Saudi Arabia without an agreement for its citizens to attend the Muslim haj pilgrimage this year, Saudi media have reported, a second failure by the rival Middle East powers to strike a deal....
docs.lead_paragraph: An Iranian delegation has left Saudi Arabia without an agreement for its citizens to attend the Muslim haj pilgrimage this year, Saudi media have reported, a second failure by the rival Middle East powers to strike a deal.
